page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO WARMINSTER
page.content:
Warminster is a country town of about 15000 people, lying between the rolling woods of Longleat and the dramatic chalk scenery of the western escarpment of Salisbury Plain.
The town has few natural resources so it has only light industry, but it is a busy shopping and service centre for surrounding villages. Other sources of employment are the various military facilities, and increasing tourism.
The centre is almost unchanged from the 18th and 19th centuries, but since the 1960s the town has become popular as a residential area, especially for retirement, with several new estates on the outskirts. Traffic from 5 major roads, which at present runs through the town, will be diverted by a by-pass after 1987.
